TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DirectoryVirtualListView extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The DirectoryVirtualListView class specifies how to conduct a virtual list view search. A virtual list view search enables users to view search results as address-book style virtual list views. It is specifically designed for very large result sets. Search data is retrieved in contiguous subsets of a sorted directory search.

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 beforeCount, int32 afterCount, string target, class System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListViewContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: A <see cref="T:System.Int32"> data type objects that gets or sets a value to indicate the number of entries after the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
A <see cref="T:System.Int32"> data type object that gets or sets a value to indicate the number of entries after the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
A <see cref="T:System.String"> that gets or sets a value to indicate the desired target entry requested by the client.
A <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListViewContext"> data type objects that gets or sets a value to indicate the virtual list view search response.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView"> class with the before count, after count, target and context set.
Gets or sets a value to indicate the number of entries after the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
Docs.value: An integer value that represents the number of entries after the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate the estimated total count of items in the list.
Docs.value: An integer value that represents the estimated total count of items in the list.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate the number of entries before the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
Docs.value: An integer value that represents the number of entries before the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate the virtual list view search response.
Docs.value: A <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListViewContext"> that indicates the virtual list view search response.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate the target entry's offset within the list.
Docs.value: An integer value that represents the target entry's estimated offset within the list.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When this property is set, a new value for the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.TargetPercentage%2A> property is computed by dividing the value of the Offset property by the value of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.ApproximateTotal%2A> property, and multiplying the result by 100.

Docs.summary: The Target property gets or sets a value to indicate the target entry that was requested by the client.
Docs.value: A string that contains the target entry that was requested by the client.

Docs.summary: The TargetPercentage property gets or sets a value to indicate the estimated target entry's requested offset within the list, as a percentage of the total number of items in the list.
Docs.value: An integer value that represents the estimated percentage offset within the list of the target entry.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When this property is set, a new value for the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.Offset%2A> property is computed by multiplying the value of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.ApproximateTotal%2A> property by the value of the TargetPercentage property, and dividing the result by 100.
